intro: Pseudognaphalium purpurascens, commonly known as the purple tansy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from yellow to purple. Pseudognaphalium purpurascens is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine by indigenous peoples.
